title: CoachBase | Our Privacy Policy
content:
Introduction

This Website is owned and operated by CoachBase Pte Ltd, a company registered in Singapore under ACRA number 202018754G.

CoachBase.io (or also referred to as www.CoachBase.io or “the Website” or "this Website" or "the Platform") is an online directory of executive, business, career, life, relationship, mental health and wellness Coaches (referred to as "Coach(es)" or "Trainee Coach(es)" or "Peer Coach(es)"). Individuals who are seeking Coach or Coaches are also known as "Client(s)" or "Peer Client(s)".

This Data Privacy Policy sets forth the terms and conditions under which we collect and process data and information on the Website and in relation to the services offered.

This Website offers visitors online executive, business, career, life, relationship, health and wellness coaching services.

By accessing or using the Website and the services, you approve that you have read, understood, and agree with our Data Privacy Policy.

Please read the Data Privacy Policy below, even if you have read them before. CoachBase Data Privacy Policy is regularly updated.

The terms "CoachBase" or "we" or "us" or "the Company" or "the Platform" or "the Website" refer to CoachBase Pte Ltd, and the owner of the Website. The term "you" or "Users" or "Visitors" refers to the user or viewer of the Website.

1. What type of information is collected?

We receive, collect, and store any information you enter on the website or provide us in any other way.

We can also collect the Internet Protocol (IP) address used to connect your computer to the Internet, computer, and connection information. We may use software tools to measure and collect web session information, including page response times, length of visits to certain pages, page interaction information, and methods used to browse away from the page.

We also collect personally identifiable information that you voluntarily share with us (including name, email, phone, Skype ID, and communication content); payment details, comments, feedback, testimonials (i.e., either your rating as a client using coaching services and related comments following a coaching session, or your testimonial on your experience with the Website itself - both may include personally identifiable information prior to posting for which you provide permission), and recommendations.

From time to time, we may provide you the opportunity to participate in contests or surveys on our Website. If you participate, we may request certain personally identifiable information from you. Participation in these surveys or contests is completely voluntary and you therefore have a choice on whether or not to disclose this information. The requested information typically includes contact information (such as name and shipping address), and demographic information (such as zip code). We use this information to notify contest winners and award prizes, to monitor site traffic or personalize the Website.

If you are a Coach who registers with us, we can collect additional information such as your type of services and related pricing, your Skype ID (or other communication medium), your coaching time slot availabilities, links to your professional websites or social media (e.g., LinkedIn) that you provide, your coaching training/education/certification and service details, your picture and bio descriptions, location (city, state, province, time zone), or your publications (e.g., articles, videos, events) that you submit to us. We are also providing Coaches with the ability to voluntarily connect their personal Zoom account through an API, so that their video conference call solution can be proposed to end clients at the occasion of the booking of a coaching session. For that purpose, we collect and store users token, personal meeting URL, Zoom ID, account ID, pmi, phone number, country, and location.

Upon submission of your publications, you provide your consent that the latter can be made visible to public on our website and our/your social media, together with the name of the Coach who has submitted it and a link to his/her profile on the Platform. In order to enable us to manage volumes and storage, the duration of the publication made visible to the public will be at the Platform’s discretion. Submitted publications are stored by the Platform for an unlimited duration on a free and secured cloud database. If Coaches wish to withdraw, amend or delete a publication stored by us, they can do so by contacting us at: info@coachbase.io.

This information is collected for the purpose of being publicly displayed on the Website for prospective coaching clients to see (e.g., via the Coach directory and public profile); we will list you in our publicly accessible Coach directory unless you choose to not offer services to prospecting coaching clients (doable through the “unable/disable” option from your Coach profile; by emailing us at info@coachbase.io or by deleting your account from your profile page).

We also collect your Stripe account details if you choose to offer your services to prospective coaching clients on the Platform.

Apart from your password, credit card and Stripe account information, all of the information that you voluntarily submit to the Website may be publicly displayed.

We also collect information related to the coaching session booking processes, related payments (e.g., service selected, amount paid, credit card for payment processing only) and feedback/queries to ensure smooth coordination of the coaching services, this information may be shared between the Clients and the Coaches.

Lastly, we also collect information related to key performance indicators/statistics to feed the dashboard and benchmarking functionality offered by the Platform (viewable by registered Coaches in an anonymized way only).

2. How do we collect personal information?

When website visitors and users send us a message through the contact form, register with us, purchase a service, or subscribe to the newsletter (please refer to section 1 for details).

Your personal information will be used for the treatment of your requests, answering of questions, coaching services, and marketing purposes.

The information requested as part of the contact form, the registration process, the service purchase and execution, or the newsletter subscription, is mandatory for the good treatment of your requests. Default from answering the information may lead to an inability to contact you back and/or address your request.

By providing your information through the contact form, the registration process, the service purchase and execution, or the newsletter subscription, you give us the consent to treat and store your personal information.

3. Why do we collect personal information?

We collect non-personal and personal Information for the following purposes:

  1. To provide and operate the services.
  2. To provide Users with ongoing customer assistance and technical support.
  3. To be able to contact Visitors and Users with general or personalized service-related notices, promotional and campaign messages.
  4. To create aggregated statistical data and other aggregated and/or inferred non-personal information, which we or our sales and marketing business partners may use to provide and improve the respective services.
  5. To comply with any applicable laws and regulations.
4. How do we store, use, share and disclose site visitors’ personal information?

International Data Transfer
By using our online coaching platform, you (Coaches and Clients) agree that your personal data, as provided by you or collected by us through the use of our services, may be processed and transferred outside of Singapore for operational purposes. This includes, but is not limited to, matching clients with coaches and providing user support, IT, and operational services. We ensure that any transfer of your data outside of Singapore is done in compliance with applicable data protection laws, including the Singapore Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA). We take all necessary steps to safeguard your personal information and maintain its confidentiality.

Service providers
We use third parties to provide various services on our behalf such as for hosting purposes, email services, credit card and payment processing, coaching session booking services, publications, or third-party advertising and marketing.

Hosting
The Website is hosted on aws.amazon.com. Aws.amazon.com provides us with the online platform that allows us to offer services to you. Your data may be stored through aws.amazon.com’s data storage, databases and the general aws.amazon.com applications. They store your data on secure servers behind a firewall.

Emails
For booking and payment processing purposes, when you write us or sign up to receive our newsletter, we will share your email address with our email service provider.

Payments
When you subscribe to a paid plan or service on the Website, we use a credit card processor to store your credit card details in a secure location, and also to charge your credit card when payments are due for payments. We use Stripe.com as a payment gateway. Stripe is one of the leading payment providers in the world. Your payment information may be stored by Stripe and their business partners such as but not limited to Visa, Mastercard, or American Express. Additionally, Stripe collects identifying information about the devices that connect to its services. Stripe uses this information to operate and improve the services it provides to us, including for fraud detection. You can learn more about Stripe and read its privacy policy.

Coaching Session Booking
Coaches are provided with the ability to voluntarily connect their video call solution providers (e.g., Zoom) and calendar solution providers (e.g., Google, MS 365, iCloud, Exchange) to synchronize their availabilities and coach booking slots. We use API to connect each of these solutions through the Website.

Publications
Coaches are provided with the ability to voluntarily publish their own publications (e.g., articles, videos, events) on the Website and CoachBase’s social media pages (LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Telegram, YouTube) as well as their own social media pages through CoachBase (button that the Coach can unable/disable upon submitting the publications). The latter involves the display of CoachBase logo and related service information together with the publication, the name of the Coach who has submitted it and a link to his/her profile on the Platform. By submitting their publications, Coaches give their consent for CoachBase and their third-party digital marketing providers to publish their publications on their behalf, and make them visible to the public.

In order to enable us to manage volumes and storage, and ensure adequacy with the platform brand positioning, the publication and duration of the publication made visible to the public will be at the Platform’s discretion.

Submitted publications are stored by the Platform for an unlimited duration on a free and secured cloud database. If Coaches wish to withdraw, amend, or delete a publication stored by us, they can do so by contacting us at: info@coachbase.io.

Third Party Advertising
Ads appearing on the Website may be delivered to users by CoachBase or one of our Web advertising partners. Our Web advertising partners may set cookies. These cookies allow the ad server to recognize your computer each time they send you an online advertisement. In this way, ad servers may compile information about where you, or others who are using your computer, saw their advertisements and determine which ads are clicked on. This information allows our advertising network to deliver targeted advertisements that they believe will be of most interest to you. This Data Privacy Policy covers the use of cookies by CoachBase only and does not cover the use of cookies by any advertisers. We have no access or control of these third-party cookies.

Our third-party advertising partners may employ a software technology called clear gifs (a.k.a. Web Beacons/Web Bugs), that help us better manage content on our site by informing us what content is effective. Clear gifs are tiny graphics with a unique identifier, similar in function to cookies, and are used to track the online movements of Web users. In contrast to cookies, which are stored on a user’s computer hard drive, clear gifs are embedded invisibly on Web pages and are about the size of the period at the end of this sentence. We do not tie the information gathered by clear gifs to our customers personally identifiable information.

Links to Other Sites
This Website contains links to other sites that are not owned or controlled by CoachBase. Please be aware that we, CoachBase, are not responsible for the data privacy practices of such other sites.

We encourage you to be aware when you leave our site and to read the privacy statements of each and every website that collects personally identifiable information.

This data privacy statement applies only to information collected by CoachBase Website.

Co-Branding
Please note that when you use our Feedback Page and other Feedback features, you will be on a third-party site. The pages will be branded as ours but powered by the third party. Please note that the third parties’ privacy policy governs the collection and use of information provided on the site powered by them. Their privacy policy link is included on each of the co-branded pages.

CoachBase Social Media and Forums
If you comment on posts published on the CoachBase social media and forums, you should be aware that any personally identifiable information you submit can be read, collected, or used by other users of these forums and could be used to send you unsolicited messages. We are not responsible for the personally identifiable information you choose to submit in these forums. To request removal of your personal information from our blog or community forum, contact us at info@coachbase.io. In some cases, we may not be able to remove your personal information, in which case we will let you know if we are unable to do so and why.

Social Media Widgets
Our Website includes Social Media features, such as the Like button. These Features may collect your IP address, which page you are visiting on our site, and may set a cookie to enable the feature to function properly. Social Media Features and Widgets are either hosted by a third party or hosted directly on our Website. Your interactions with these features are governed by the privacy policy of the company providing it.

Third parties are prohibited from using your personally identifiable information for any other purpose including their own marketing. These companies are authorized to use your personal information only as necessary to provide these services to us.

Information stored by us will be maintained and treated confidentially regardless if it is in print or digital/electronic format and for a period of not more than 24 months after information provision, following a period of 24 months of inactivity. After this period, the information will be discarded unless required to be maintained by law.

Lastly, if CoachBase is involved in a merger, acquisition, or sale of all or a portion of its assets, you will be notified via email and/or a prominent notice on our Website of any change in ownership or uses of your personal information, as well as any choices you may have regarding your personal information.

Legal Disclaimer

We may be obligated to share information with legal enforcement agencies according to relevant local regulations upon their request. We reserve the right to disclose your personally identifiable information as required by law and when we believe that disclosure is necessary to protect our rights and/or to comply with a judicial proceeding, court order, or legal process served on our Website.

We will share your personal information with third parties only in ways that are described in this data privacy policy. We do not sell your personal information to third parties.

5. How do we communicate with site visitors?

We may contact you to notify you regarding the services we provide to you and manage related bookings, payments, and queries, to share marketing campaigns that we may find valuable to you, to poll your opinions through surveys or questionnaires, to send updates about the company, or as otherwise necessary to contact you to enforce our Terms of Use, applicable national laws, and any agreement we may have with you. For these purposes we may contact you via email, telephone, and text messages.

We may also send you our newsletter if you opt to receive this communication from CoachBase. If you wish to unsubscribe from promotional emails including newsletters, you may do so by following the unsubscribe instructions included in each promotional email.

Lastly, CoachBase may send you service-related announcements from time to time through the general operation of the service. Generally, you may opt out of such emails which are not promotional in nature by editing your notifications settings, though CoachBase reserves the right to send you notices about your account even if you opt out of all voluntary e-mail notifications.

When you use CoachBase as a potential coaching client, you may request/purchase a consultation directly from one of the coaches listed in our directory as part of the booking process or participate in our Referral Program.

If you request a consultation as part of the booking process, we will ask for your name, phone, location/time-zone, email address and your comments if any via the Platform to process the booking and payment if any on your behalf. You and your Coach will receive emails with the booking and payment details.

If you participate in the CoachBase Client Referral Program (i.e., get a Coach recommended to you), we ask for your name, email address, phone number (optional), location, your goal for hiring a coach, and any additional details that pertain to your request for a coach. By default, we will publish your request (not including personally identifiable details) as a means for communicating to Coaches your request. After submitting your referral request, we contact you to collect more information about your coaching needs, send you up to five recommended coaches, and periodically follow-up with you to ensure that we have delivered a high-quality service. In all cases, CoachBase stores personal information to track the success of our services.

6. How do we use cookies and other tracking tools?

As is true of most websites, we gather certain information automatically and store it in log files. This information includes Internet protocol (IP) addresses, browser type, Internet service provider (ISP), referring/exit pages, operating system, date/time stamp, and clickstream data.

We may combine this automatically collected log information with other information we collect about you. We do this to improve services we offer you, to improve marketing, analytics, or site functionality.

The Website may track personal information using software, cookies and tracking tools (e.g., cookies, flash cookies, web beacons, tags, scripts etc.). This information is used by CoachBase and our analytics affiliate, or email partner.

These technologies are used in generating statistics, measuring and collecting session information, including page response times, length of visits to certain pages, page interaction information, and methods used to browse away from the page, analyzing trends, administering the site, tracking users’ movements around the site and to gather demographic information about our user base as a whole. We may receive reports based on the use of these technologies by these companies on an individual as well as aggregated basis.

We use cookies to remember users’ settings (e.g., language preference) and for authentication. Users can control the use of cookies at the individual browser level. If you reject cookies, you may still use our site, but your ability to use some features or areas of our site may be limited.

Please note that third-party services, such as Google Analytics or other applications offered through aws.amazon.com, placing cookies or utilizing other tracking technologies through aws.amazon.com's services, may have their own policies regarding how they collect and store information. As these are external services, such practices are not covered by aws.amazon.com's data privacy policy.

Third parties with whom we partner to provide certain features on our site or to display advertising based upon your Web browsing activity use LSOs such as HTML 5 to collect and store information.

Various browsers may offer their own management tools for removing HTML5 LSOs.

7.How can site visitors change or remove information?

Access and control over most personal information on CoachBase is readily available through the profile editing tools for the Coach. The Coach may modify or delete any of his/her profile information at any time by logging into your account and submitting the changes to us.

Individuals who wish to cancel their CoachBase account may do so from their profile page. Removed information may persist in backup copies for a reasonable period of time but will not be generally available.

We will retain your information for as long as your account is active or as needed to provide you services. Our default retention period is 24 months, but we will retain and use your information as necessary to comply with our legal obligations, resolve disputes, and enforce our agreements.

8.Security

The security of your personal information is important to us. We follow generally accepted standards to protect the personal information submitted to us, both during transmission and once we receive it. CoachBase takes appropriate precautions to protect our users’ information. Your account information is located on a secured server behind a firewall. When we collect sensitive information such as your credit card, we use SSL encryption to protect this data. However, no method of transmission over the Internet, or method of electronic storage, is 100% secure. Therefore, while we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your personal information, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

Because email and instant messaging are not recognized as secure communications, we recommend you to be mindful of the private information you share with us by e-mail or instant messaging services.

9.Release of information

The Coach may engage in training and continuing education pursuing and/or maintaining Coaching credentials. That process may require the names and contact information of Clients for possible verification by the coaching organizations granting these credentials. By buying coaching services on the Platform, Clients agree to have only their name, contact information, and start and end dates of coaching shared with staff members of these coaching organizations and/or other parties involved in this process for the sole and necessary purpose of verifying the coaching relationship for professional accreditation purposes.

According to the ethics of the coaching profession, topics may be anonymously and hypothetically shared with other coaching professionals for training, supervision, mentoring, evaluation, and for coach professional development and/or consultation purposes.

10.Record retention policy

The Client acknowledges that the Coach has their own record retention policy with respect to documents, information and data acquired or shared during the term of the Coach-Client relationship. Such records need to be maintained by the Coach in a format of the Coach’s choice (e.g., print or digital/electronic) and secured/treated confidentially throughout the contract and for a period of not more than 24 months after contract termination. The Coach commits to send the notes to the Client on request, and to destroy them after 24 months.

11.Privacy policy updates

We reserve the right to modify this data privacy policy at any time, so please review it frequently. The date at the top of this page indicates when this policy was last revised. This policy applies to all information that we have about you, and to your account with us. Changes and clarifications will take effect immediately upon their posting on the website.

If we make changes to this policy, we will post those changes to this data privacy statement and other places we deem appropriate, so that you are aware of what information we collect, how we use it, and under what circumstances, if any, we use and/or disclose it.

If we make material changes to this policy, we will notify you that it has been updated here, by email, or by means of a prominent notice when you log into the Website prior to the change becoming effective.

12.Ownership of intellectual property, copyrights, and logos

We reserve the right to modify this data privacy policy at any time, so please review it frequently. The date at the top of this page indicates when this policy was last revised. This policy applies to all information that we have about you, and to your account with us. Changes and clarifications will take effect immediately upon their posting on the website.

If we make changes to this policy, we will post those changes to this data privacy statement and other places we deem appropriate, so that you are aware of what information we collect, how we use it, and under what circumstances, if any, we use and/or disclose it.

13.Limitation of liability

First, to the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, in no event shall CoachBase, be liable for any indirect, punitive, incidental, special, consequential or exemplary damages, including without limitation, damages for loss of profits, goodwill, use, data or other intangible losses, arising out of or relating to the use of, or inability to use, the service.

To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, CoachBase assume no liability or responsibility for any:

  • errors, mistakes, or inaccuracies of content;
  • personal injury or property damage, of any nature whatsoever, resulting from your access to or use of the service and;
  • any unauthorized access to or use of the secure servers and/or any and all personal information stored therein.
14.Preference of law and dispute resolution

This policy provided hereunder, and any and all claims and disputes related hereto and/or to the data, shall be governed by, construed under and enforced in all respects solely and exclusively in accordance with the internal substantive laws of Singapore, without respect to its conflict of laws principles. Any and all such claims and disputes shall be brought in, and you hereby consent to them being decided exclusively by a court of competent jurisdiction located in Singapore. The application of the United Nations Convention of Contracts for the International Sale of Goods is hereby expressly excluded.

15.Questions and contact information

If you would like to: oppose, access, correct, amend, or delete any personal information we have about you, or have any questions or concerns related to protection of personal data, these data privacy policies, or the security on our Website, you are invited to contact us at:

  • Email: info@coachbase.io
  • Address: CoachBase Pte Ltd, 7 Temasek Boulevard, #12-07 Suntec Tower One, Singapore (038987)
  • Phone: +65 9857 7953

Submitted publications are stored by the Platform for an unlimited duration on a free and secured cloud database. If Coaches wish to withdraw, amend or delete a publication stored by us, they can do so by contacting us at: info@coachbase.io.

Default from answering the information may lead to an inability to contact you back and/or address your request.

This includes, but is not limited to, matching clients with coaches and providing user support, IT, and operational services. We ensure that any transfer of your data outside of Singapore is done in compliance with applicable data protection laws, including the Singapore Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA). We take all necessary steps to safeguard your personal information and maintain its confidentiality.

Your data may be stored through aws.amazon.com’s data storage, databases and the general aws.amazon.com applications. They store your data on secure servers behind a firewall.
                   Emails
                    For booking and payment processing purposes, when you write us or sign up to receive our newsletter, we will share your email address with our email service provider.
                  
                   Payments
                    When you subscribe to a paid plan or service on the Website, we use a credit card processor to store your credit card details in a secure location, and also to charge your credit card when payments are due for payments. We use Stripe.com as a payment gateway. Stripe is one of the leading payment providers in the world. Your payment information may be stored by Stripe and their business partners such as but not limited to Visa, Mastercard, or American Express. Additionally, Stripe collects identifying information about the devices that connect to its services. Stripe uses this information to operate and improve the services it provides to us, including for fraud detection. You can learn more about Stripe and read its privacy policy.

We use API to connect each of these solutions through the Website.
                  
                   Publications
                    Coaches are provided with the ability to voluntarily publish their own publications (e.g., articles, videos, events) on the Website and CoachBase’s social media pages (LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Telegram, YouTube) as well as their own social media pages through CoachBase (button that the Coach can unable/disable upon submitting the publications). The latter involves the display of CoachBase logo and related service information together with the publication, the name of the Coach who has submitted it and a link to his/her profile on the Platform. By submitting their publications, Coaches give their consent for CoachBase and their third-party digital marketing providers to publish their publications on their behalf, and make them visible to the public.
                  
                  In order to enable us to manage volumes and storage, and ensure adequacy with the platform brand positioning, the publication and duration of the publication made visible to the public will be at the Platform’s discretion.
                  Submitted publications are stored by the Platform for an unlimited duration on a free and secured cloud database. If Coaches wish to withdraw, amend, or delete a publication stored by us, they can do so by contacting us at: info@coachbase.io. 
                   Third Party Advertising
                    Ads appearing on the Website may be delivered to users by CoachBase or one of our Web advertising partners. Our Web advertising partners may set cookies. These cookies allow the ad server to recognize your computer each time they send you an online advertisement. In this way, ad servers may compile information about where you, or others who are using your computer, saw their advertisements and determine which ads are clicked on. This information allows our advertising network to deliver targeted advertisements that they believe will be of most interest to you. This Data Privacy Policy covers the use of cookies by CoachBase only and does not cover the use of cookies by any advertisers. We have no access or control of these third-party cookies.
                  
                  Our third-party advertising partners may employ a software technology called clear gifs (a.k.a. Web Beacons/Web Bugs), that help us better manage content on our site by informing us what content is effective. Clear gifs are tiny graphics with a unique identifier, similar in function to cookies, and are used to track the online movements of Web users. In contrast to cookies, which are stored on a user’s computer hard drive, clear gifs are embedded invisibly on Web pages and are about the size of the period at the end of this sentence. We do not tie the information gathered by clear gifs to our customers personally identifiable information.
                   Links to Other Sites
                    This Website contains links to other sites that are not owned or controlled by CoachBase. Please be aware that we, CoachBase, are not responsible for the data privacy practices of such other sites.
                  
                  We encourage you to be aware when you leave our site and to read the privacy statements of each and every website that collects personally identifiable information.
                  This data privacy statement applies only to information collected by CoachBase Website.
                  Co-Branding Please note that when you use our Feedback Page and other Feedback features, you will be on a third-party site. The pages will be branded as ours but powered by the third party. Please note that the third parties’ privacy policy governs the collection and use of information provided on the site powered by them. Their privacy policy link is included on each of the co-branded pages.
                  CoachBase Social Media and Forums
                    If you comment on posts published on the CoachBase social media and forums, you should be aware that any personally identifiable information you submit can be read, collected, or used by other users of these forums and could be used to send you unsolicited messages. We are not responsible for the personally identifiable information you choose to submit in these forums. To request removal of your personal information from our blog or community forum, contact us at info@coachbase.io. In some cases, we may not be able to remove your personal information, in which case we will let you know if we are unable to do so and why.
                  Social Media Widgets Our Website includes Social Media features, such as the Like button. These Features may collect your IP address, which page you are visiting on our site, and may set a cookie to enable the feature to function properly. Social Media Features and Widgets are either hosted by a third party or hosted directly on our Website. Your interactions with these features are governed by the privacy policy of the company providing it.
                  Third parties are prohibited from using your personally identifiable information for any other purpose including their own marketing. These companies are authorized to use your personal information only as necessary to provide these services to us.
                  Information stored by us will be maintained and treated confidentially regardless if it is in print or digital/electronic format and for a period of not more than 24 months after information provision, following a period of 24 months of inactivity. After this period, the information will be discarded unless required to be maintained by law.
                  Lastly, if CoachBase is involved in a merger, acquisition, or sale of all or a portion of its assets, you will be notified via email and/or a prominent notice on our Website of any change in ownership or uses of your personal information, as well as any choices you may have regarding your personal information.
                  Legal Disclaimer
                  We may be obligated to share information with legal enforcement agencies according to relevant local regulations upon their request. We reserve the right to disclose your personally identifiable information as required by law and when we believe that disclosure is necessary to protect our rights and/or to comply with a judicial proceeding, court order, or legal process served on our Website.
                  We will share your personal information with third parties only in ways that are described in this data privacy policy. We do not sell your personal information to third parties.
                
                
                  5. How do we communicate with site visitors?
                  We may contact you to notify you regarding the services we provide to you and manage related bookings, payments, and queries, to share marketing campaigns that we may find valuable to you, to poll your opinions through surveys or questionnaires, to send updates about the company, or as otherwise necessary to contact you to enforce our Terms of Use, applicable national laws, and any agreement we may have with you. For these purposes we may contact you via email, telephone, and text messages.
                  We may also send you our newsletter if you opt to receive this communication from CoachBase. If you wish to unsubscribe from promotional emails including newsletters, you may do so by following the unsubscribe instructions included in each promotional email.
                  Lastly, CoachBase may send you service-related announcements from time to time through the general operation of the service. Generally, you may opt out of such emails which are not promotional in nature by editing your notifications settings, though CoachBase reserves the right to send you notices about your account even if you opt out of all voluntary e-mail notifications.
                  When you use CoachBase as a potential coaching client, you may request/purchase a consultation directly from one of the coaches listed in our directory as part of the booking process or participate in our Referral Program.
                  If you request a consultation as part of the booking process, we will ask for your name, phone, location/time-zone, email address and your comments if any via the Platform to process the booking and payment if any on your behalf. You and your Coach will receive emails with the booking and payment details.
                  If you participate in the CoachBase Client Referral Program (i.e., get a Coach recommended to you), we ask for your name, email address, phone number (optional), location, your goal for hiring a coach, and any additional details that pertain to your request for a coach. By default, we will publish your request (not including personally identifiable details) as a means for communicating to Coaches your request. After submitting your referral request, we contact you to collect more information about your coaching needs, send you up to five recommended coaches, and periodically follow-up with you to ensure that we have delivered a high-quality service. In all cases, CoachBase stores personal information to track the success of our services.
                
                
                  6. How do we use cookies and other tracking tools?
                  As is true of most websites, we gather certain information automatically and store it in log files. This information includes Internet protocol (IP) addresses, browser type, Internet service provider (ISP), referring/exit pages, operating system, date/time stamp, and clickstream data.
                  We may combine this automatically collected log information with other information we collect about you. We do this to improve services we offer you, to improve marketing, analytics, or site functionality.
                  The Website may track personal information using software, cookies and tracking tools (e.g., cookies, flash cookies, web beacons, tags, scripts etc.). This information is used by CoachBase and our analytics affiliate, or email partner.
                  These technologies are used in generating statistics, measuring and collecting session information, including page response times, length of visits to certain pages, page interaction information, and methods used to browse away from the page, analyzing trends, administering the site, tracking users’ movements around the site and to gather demographic information about our user base as a whole. We may receive reports based on the use of these technologies by these companies on an individual as well as aggregated basis.
                  We use cookies to remember users’ settings (e.g., language preference) and for authentication. Users can control the use of cookies at the individual browser level. If you reject cookies, you may still use our site, but your ability to use some features or areas of our site may be limited.
                  Please note that third-party services, such as Google Analytics or other applications offered through aws.amazon.com, placing cookies or utilizing other tracking technologies through aws.amazon.com's services, may have their own policies regarding how they collect and store information. As these are external services, such practices are not covered by aws.amazon.com's data privacy policy.
                  Third parties with whom we partner to provide certain features on our site or to display advertising based upon your Web browsing activity use LSOs such as HTML 5 to collect and store information.
                  Various browsers may offer their own management tools for removing HTML5 LSOs.
                
                
                  7.How can site visitors change or remove information?
                  Access and control over most personal information on CoachBase is readily available through the profile editing tools for the Coach. The Coach may modify or delete any of his/her profile information at any time by logging into your account and submitting the changes to us.
                  Individuals who wish to cancel their CoachBase account may do so from their profile page. Removed information may persist in backup copies for a reasonable period of time but will not be generally available.
                  We will retain your information for as long as your account is active or as needed to provide you services. Our default retention period is 24 months, but we will retain and use your information as necessary to comply with our legal obligations, resolve disputes, and enforce our agreements.
                
                
                  8.Security
                  The security of your personal information is important to us. We follow generally accepted standards to protect the personal information submitted to us, both during transmission and once we receive it. CoachBase takes appropriate precautions to protect our users’ information. Your account information is located on a secured server behind a firewall. When we collect sensitive information such as your credit card, we use SSL encryption to protect this data. However, no method of transmission over the Internet, or method of electronic storage, is 100% secure. Therefore, while we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your personal information, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.
                  Because email and instant messaging are not recognized as secure communications, we recommend you to be mindful of the private information you share with us by e-mail or instant messaging services.
                
                
                  9.Release of information
                  The Coach may engage in training and continuing education pursuing and/or maintaining Coaching credentials. That process may require the names and contact information of Clients for possible verification by the coaching organizations granting these credentials. By buying coaching services on the Platform, Clients agree to have only their name, contact information, and start and end dates of coaching shared with staff members of these coaching organizations and/or other parties involved in this process for the sole and necessary purpose of verifying the coaching relationship for professional accreditation purposes.
                  According to the ethics of the coaching profession, topics may be anonymously and hypothetically shared with other coaching professionals for training, supervision, mentoring, evaluation, and for coach professional development and/or consultation purposes.
                
                
                  10.Record retention policy
                  The Client acknowledges that the Coach has their own record retention policy with respect to documents, information and data acquired or shared during the term of the Coach-Client relationship. Such records need to be maintained by the Coach in a format of the Coach’s choice (e.g., print or digital/electronic) and secured/treated confidentially throughout the contract and for a period of not more than 24 months after contract termination. The Coach commits to send the notes to the Client on request, and to destroy them after 24 months.
                
                
                  11.Privacy policy updates
                  We reserve the right to modify this data privacy policy at any time, so please review it frequently. The date at the top of this page indicates when this policy was last revised. This policy applies to all information that we have about you, and to your account with us. Changes and clarifications will take effect immediately upon their posting on the website.
                  If we make changes to this policy, we will post those changes to this data privacy statement and other places we deem appropriate, so that you are aware of what information we collect, how we use it, and under what circumstances, if any, we use and/or disclose it.
                  If we make material changes to this policy, we will notify you that it has been updated here, by email, or by means of a prominent notice when you log into the Website prior to the change becoming effective.
                
                
                  12.Ownership of intellectual property, copyrights, and logos
                  We reserve the right to modify this data privacy policy at any time, so please review it frequently. The date at the top of this page indicates when this policy was last revised. This policy applies to all information that we have about you, and to your account with us. Changes and clarifications will take effect immediately upon their posting on the website.
                  If we make changes to this policy, we will post those changes to this data privacy statement and other places we deem appropriate, so that you are aware of what information we collect, how we use it, and under what circumstances, if any, we use and/or disclose it.
                
                
                  13.Limitation of liability
                  First, to the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, in no event shall CoachBase, be liable for any indirect, punitive, incidental, special, consequential or exemplary damages, including without limitation, damages for loss of profits, goodwill, use, data or other intangible losses, arising out of or relating to the use of, or inability to use, the service.
                  To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, CoachBase assume no liability or responsibility for any:
                  
                    errors, mistakes, or inaccuracies of content;
                    personal injury or property damage, of any nature whatsoever, resulting from your access to or use of the service and;
                    any unauthorized access to or use of the secure servers and/or any and all personal information stored therein.
                  
                
                
                  14.Preference of law and dispute resolution
                  This policy provided hereunder, and any and all claims and disputes related hereto and/or to the data, shall be governed by, construed under and enforced in all respects solely and exclusively in accordance with the internal substantive laws of Singapore, without respect to its conflict of laws principles. Any and all such claims and disputes shall be brought in, and you hereby consent to them being decided exclusively by a court of competent jurisdiction located in Singapore. The application of the United Nations Convention of Contracts for the International Sale of Goods is hereby expressly excluded.
                
                
                  15.Questions and contact information
                  If you would like to: oppose, access, correct, amend, or delete any personal information we have about you, or have any questions or concerns related to protection of personal data, these data privacy policies, or the security on our Website, you are invited to contact us at:
                  
                    Email: info@coachbase.io
                    Address: CoachBase Pte Ltd, 7 Temasek Boulevard, #12-07 Suntec Tower One, Singapore (038987)
                    Phone: +65 9857 7953
excerpt: Questions to ask your Coach about CoachBase digital coaching platform's services for individuals and organizations, the price of coaching, and more.
